title: Skylo raises $37 million to scale up direct-to-device partnerships
summary: Skylo has raised $37 million to help nail down the partnerships it needs to enable more smartphones to connect to satellites for texting and other low-bandwidth services.

title: Intelsat to produce multi-orbit satellite terminals for U.S. military aircraft
summary: The company won a $9 million contract from the Air Force Research Laboratory

title: Team Assessing SHERLOC Instrument on NASA's Perseverance Rover
summary: Engineers are working to stabilize a dust cover on one of the science instrument’s cameras.

title: Starship Flight 3 Fully Stacked for WDR testing
summary: SpaceX is making good progress on Flight 3 readiness with a full stack on the pad and road closures coming up for a possible Wet Dress Rehearsal (WDR) for Booster 10 and Ship 28. SpaceX continues to work on future flight vehicles, on the path towards achieving operational status with Starship.

title: The Sun Sets on SLIM – What Next?
summary: After a troubled journey to the lunar surface and subsequent recovery, the sun has set on JAXA’s Smart Lander for Investigating Moon (SLIM) at 1:57 PM, February 1st, Japan Standard Time. Officially, SLIM has entered a dormant period, and the intent to attempt continued operations once the sun begins shining on SLIM’s solar cells again has been declared on the official page of the SLIM mission on the site formerly known as Twitter. Details on the precise nature of the difficulties faced during landing and the fruits of its limited operation on the lunar surface have been disclosed in the time since Space Scout’s last report on the mission. While the mission is in its dormant period and the chances of the mission continuing remain unclear, SLIM’s mission has accomplished its goals, and has wide reaching implications for JAXA’s future ambitions at the Moon and beyond.

title: Satellite connectivity startup Skylo hooks backers such as Intel, BMW, Samsung to raise $37 million
summary: Silicon Valley space startup Skylo Technologies landed funding from the corporate venture arms of Intel, BMW and Samsung, as the company aims to bridge the gap between satellite and terrestrial communications.

title: K2 Space, a startup with SpaceX veterans building monster satellites, raises $50 million
summary: Los Angeles-based startup K2 Space raised $50 million in new funding as the company works to build monster satellites to match the massive rockets that are coming to market.

title: SpaceX to deorbit 100 older Starlink satellites
summary: SpaceX plans to remove from orbit about 100 of its older Starlink satellites because of a design flaw that could cause them to fail.

title: Intuitive Machines ready for launch of its first lunar lander
summary: Intuitive Machines says its first lunar lander is ready for launch this week after completing a final series of tests on the launch pad.

title: The Exploration Company Continues Testing its Huracán Rocket Engine
summary:
Space transportation startup The Exploration Company has continued testing its methane-powered Huracán engine, which will power the company’s Nyx Moon spacecraft. The Exploration company is currently developing three different engines. Mistral for Nyx Earth, Huracán for Nyx Moon, and its high-thrust Typhoon engine, which currently doesn’t have a direct application but is being developed to […]
